page.title: 16Townleys Farm
page.content: The farms in our area are mainly dairy farms. Mr. Wildman is the tenant farmer at Townleys Farm. He keeps 80 milking{cows}& 60{calves}(mainly friesians) and a few{beef cattle.}They produce 200 gallons of milk per day. Milking times are at 7a.m. and again at 5p.m. The machines in the milking parlour milk 6 cows at a time. Paddy the{bull}is very gentle and we could stroke him. There are 400{pigs}in various stages of growth. The oldest weigh about 400kg and the smallest of the{piglets}were 2 days old. They are fed on pig swill which is a mash of all kinds of waste food(including school dinner leftovers). 800{hens}are kept in 2 chicken houses - it sounded like sirens when we went in - and they each lay about 1 egg per day. There were{dogs, cats & ducks}in the yard. Lena Hardman.
